trends: There have been 83 other sightings in Omaha
There was one other sighting in Omaha on or around September 7th 2007
divs: sighting detailstime and date : sept 7, 2007, 11:50 pm +\- 5 minutes. who : myself, as rider in vehicle and jerry as driver. location : harrison st. omaha ne, we were traveling west bound 132nd to 144th description : low, slow flying aircraft with no noise. it had navigation lights (red & green wing tip lights) and landing spot lights. narrative : we were returning from star viewing east of louisville ne. ,left site at 11:30 +\- 3 min. and were driving north on highway 50 (144th st. in omaha). there was a traffic accident and the interchange of hwy 50 and i-80, north bound traffic was being diverted to east bound on i-80. we exited i-80 at the harrison\giles road exit and turned north to reach harrison at 126th st.(?). turned west at the light and proceeded in the right lane. observe a light almost due west low in sky ( one to two thumb widths, from memory), i think it was south of west, less than 2 degrees (it could be seen to be within street right of way) when first noticed it was about the brightness of jupiter, and it took a minute (unmeasured) to noticeably brighten, i do not know if i saw it immediately as we turned west or as we topped the rise near 132nd st. i do not know if we stopped a a red light at 132nd st. the light did brighten, jerry mentioned the light, he said he saw a strobe, i did not see any strobe or colored light at that moment ( the object i saw was still white, but brighter, and i was not thinking aircraft yet). very quickly after jerry's remark i began to pick out a strobe, then it was apparently blocked but the wing tip lights began to stand out, they were correct, green to my left and red to my right for an approaching aircraft. the line of sight to the object had shifted right, and the object was slightly north of the roadway. we were struck by the lack of noise. we passed under the object near the intersection of 140th st?, i stuck my head out the window (the windows were open all this time) i heard no noise, looking up, the object was as wide (between wing tip lights) as two fingers (from memory), i could see a white light at the nose and the wing tip lights, giving the impression of a 45 degree swept wing aircraft, i could not see the wings or body, maybe there was the glow of a tail light so it was a diamond shape (equal sides and 90 degree corners, a square flying in the direction of the diagonal). we stopped at the light at 144th st. and i looked back with my head outside and could still see the object, a line from the street cl to the object was about a 45 degree and the object was 200' ? north of the road cl and did not appear to have traveled far. it was on a heading slightly north of east. we continued on our way, thinking little of it. thoughts and conclusions: the next day i recalled the incident, thought it may have been an f-117 going to offutt, but i do not think it could fly as slow as this appeared to be moving. from my experience a helicopter could be heard when at least 5 to 10 times the distance this appeared to be. thinking it is a full size aircraft (small business jet) i do not think it could be as low as it appeared from the other observations, if it was a 'predator' or similar aircraft it might meet what i observed. weather conditions as we observed them : it was very humid at louisville (85% rh), dew on the telescopes caused us to quit star watching. otherwise the night was very clear and stars were visible and bright. high cirrus clouds visible at sunset did not seem to bother viewing. temps in mid-60s. the windshield continually fogged and jerry operated the wipers intermittently. as we got north of springfield this seemed to dissipate and windshield remained clear. after we turned north on 156th st. the windshield fogged again. reporting : at about 12:30 sept. 8th jerry called and said he was reporting this to mufon and asked if i would also, this was written in the next hour and saved on my computer.
Summary: aircraft flying slow, low and silent, with lights
